trans-unit.source: Represents the contents of a wst:Entropy or a wst:RequestedProofToken element inside the RequestSecurityToken and RequestSecurityTokenResponse.

Represents the contents of a wst:Entropy or a wst:RequestedProofToken element inside the wst:RequestSecurityToken (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken>) and wst:RequestSecurityTokenResponse (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse>) messages.
For more information about the element that this class represents, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.ProtectedKey"></xref> class with no encryption.
Use this constructor to send the key material in clear text.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.ProtectedKey.WrappingCredentials%2A> property is set to `null` in the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.ProtectedKey> instance.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the key material to be protected.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.ProtectedKey"></xref> class using the specified encrypting credentials.
Use this constructor to send the key material encrypted.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the key material to be protected.
An <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials"></xref> that contains the credentials used to encrypt the key material.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the key material.
Gets the encrypting credentials for the key.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService.EncryptingCredentials"></xref> that represents the credentials used to encrypt the key.
`null` indicates that the key is not encrypted.
